description.narrative:
"As a supplement to the core allocation Denmark will, as a new initiative, contribute to innovation in UNFPA with an annual contribution of DKK 12 million yearly in 2014-2015. The purpose of the contribution is to fund key pioneering and innovative activities or approaches in headquarters and/or in the field and with a special focus on the Danish priorities
The innovation facility will enable quick assessments of innovative ideas and projects in the UN Women country offices based on a number of set criteria on the ideas¿ and projects¿ potential to be taken to scale. Furthermore, the facility allows for funding of innovative ideas and projects to allow them to reach a point where they can present the data to scale
In addition, UNFPA is expected to continue to receive softly earmarked and flexible contributions for its humanitarian work through the Humanitarian Partnership Framework Agreement. "
